intro: Eriolaena hily subsp. boinensis, commonly known as the Bornean eriolaena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in lowland forest understories, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical biodiversity.
